action.action-desc: Mr. Golden (for himself and Ms. Pingree) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Maine Indian Claims Settlement Act of 1980 to advance equality for Wabanaki nations, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Advancing Equality for Wabanaki Nations Act.

subsection.text: The Maine Indian Claims Settlement Act of 1980 (Public Law 96–420) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (m), by striking and at the end;
in subsection (n), by striking the period and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: Mi’kmaq Nation means the sole successor to the Micmac Nation as constituted in aboriginal times in what is now the State of Maine, and all its predecessors and successors in interest, and which is represented, as of the date of enactment of this subsection, as to lands within the United States, by the Mi’kmaq Council.

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking provided in section 8(e) and section 5(d)(4) and inserting otherwise provided in this Act; and

clause.text: by striking Except as otherwise provided in this Act, the and inserting The;
in the first sentence, by inserting or enacted for the benefit of before Indians, Indian nations;
by inserting that is in effect as of the date of the enactment of the Advancing Equality for Wabanaki Nations Act, (2) after United States (1);
by striking also (2) and inserting also (3); and
by inserting , unless Federal law or the State laws of Maine provide for the application of such Federal law or regulation after State and before the period at the end.
